com.stephanlajaunie.projects.messaging.service.client

Interface Client

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientConsole

    public interface Client

    Encapsulates a client which connects to a Server to initiate requests for an authenticated account's stored messages, and to send messages to other accounts via the Server. User will interact with the server via the console, using commands dictated by the Protocol.

    Each client instance will be associated with a single account. From the client, can access and interact with the account's message store, and send new messages to the Server via the Client. The account's credentials will have to be verified prior to accessing the message store or sending messages to the Server. Once access is granted to the Account's message store, the client can read existing messages, send new message to another recipient, and close the client/connection.

    Most methods will return a String representing the response from the server consistent with the Protocol. In this way, implementations can further handle the response, or can show the User that actual response (if for example, the response consists of all messages currently in a User's message store).

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String connect(int port, com.stephanlajaunie.projects.messaging.service.Protocol command)

      Sends a command to the Server indicating that the client instance will be terminating further connections.

      Sends a login command to the server.

      Sends a read command to the Server requesting all messages for the authenticated account.
      java.lang.String sendAction(java.lang.String command, java.lang.String response)
      Sends a send command to the Server.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        java.lang.String connect(int port,
                         com.stephanlajaunie.projects.messaging.service.Protocol command)
        Initiates a Socket connection with a Server.
        Parameters:
        port - the port on which the Socket will be opened
        command - the instance of Protocol which will be transmitted to the server
        Returns:
        a String representing the response from the server

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Sends a command to the Server indicating that the client instance will be terminating further connections. Terminates the client program.

      • readAction

        java.lang.String readAction(java.lang.String command,
                            java.lang.String response)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a read command to the Server requesting all messages for the authenticated account.
        Parameters:
        command - the read command consistent with the Protocol
        response - the response that will be returned from the server. Expects that the response will be a formatted list of the messages currently contained in the User's message store, or if the command sent was not recognized by the server
        Returns:
        a String representing the response from the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading User input

      • sendAction

        java.lang.String sendAction(java.lang.String command,
                            java.lang.String response)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a send command to the Server. Creates a message string and transmits it to the Server consistent with the Protocol.
        Parameters:
        command - the send command consistent with the Protocol
        response - the response that will be returned from the server. Expects that response will be a confirmation whether the message was successfully sent, or if the command sent was not recognized by the server
        Returns:
        a String representing the response from the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading User input

      • forwardAction

        java.lang.String forwardAction(java.lang.String command,
                               java.lang.String response)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a forward command to the server. User will need to specify a recipient and the message number to be sent. Creates a message string and transmits it to the Server consistent with the Protocol.
        Parameters:
        command - the forward command consistent with the Protocol
        response - a String representing the response from the server. Expects that response will be a confirmation whether the message was successfully forwarded, or if the command sent was not recognized by the server
        Returns:
        a String representing the response from the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading User input

      • deleteAction

        java.lang.String deleteAction(java.lang.String command,
                              java.lang.String response)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a delete command to the server. User will need to specify the message number to be deleted.
        Parameters:
        command - the delete command consistent with the Protocol
        response - a String representing the response from the server. Expects that response will be a confirmation whether the message was successfully forwarded by the server, or if the command sent was not recognized by the server
        Returns:
        a String representing the response from the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading User input

      • loginAction

        java.lang.String loginAction(java.lang.String command,
                             java.lang.String response)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a login command to the server. User will be prompted for a username and password.
        Parameters:
        command - the login command consistent with the Protocol
        response - a String representing the response from the server. Expects that response will be a confirmation whether login credentials match those associated with an account on the server, or if the command was not recognized by the server
        Returns:
        a String representing the response from the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading User input
